question: India’s first “Pristine air-quality monitoring station” has been set up at which of the following places?
explanation: A new air monitoring system has been established at Palampur in Himachal Pradesh. It has been set in collaboration between the CSIR-NPL (Council of Scientific and Industrial Research -National Physical Laboratory) & CSIR-IHBT (Institute of Himalayan Bioresource Technology). The New Institute is located at an altitude of 1391m. The new air monitoring system measures the level of pollutants like CO, NO, NO2, NH3, SO2, O3, PM, HC, CO2 & CH4 present in the atmosphere.
